text: Italian researchers reported the first case of virgin birth in the smooth-hound shark, where two female sharks produced offspring without male fertilization. text: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center issued a geomagnetic storm warning for July 30 to August 1 after intense solar activity. Auroras could be visible in mid-latitudes. This warning stemmed from multiple M-class solar flares and CMEs, suggesting potential G3 conditions. Periods of G2 are also anticipated. The first CME impacted Earth's magnetic field on July 29, initiating a minor storm.
title: Dazzling Auroras possible as geomagnetic storms likely to hit earth

text: Nasa's DART spacecraft captured detailed images of asteroids Dimorphos and Didymos just before it deliberately crashed. The impact was part of a mission to gain new insights into these celestial bodies. Dimorphos, the smaller companion asteroid, has a surface covered with rocks of various sizes. Although Dimorphos lacks significant cratering, it features several cracks or "faults" across its surface.
title: Nasa's DART asteroid unlocks complex history of twin space rock targets; see pics

text: Kelly Haston, a 53-year-old biologist, completed a year-long NASA simulation called CHAPEA Mission 1 in Texas to study the impact of isolation on health and performance for future Mars missions. text: The FDA approved Guardant Health's Shield blood test for colon cancer screening, making it likely to be covered by Medicare and private insurers. It is effective at detecting later-stage cancers but not early-stage polyps. A positive result requires follow-up with a colonoscopy. Doctors see potential for increased screening rates, but its impact on reducing mortality remains to be seen.

text: Alligators and crocodiles, both belonging to different families within the Crocodylia genus, exhibited distinct traits despite their similarities. Key differences included snout shape, visibility of teeth, skin color, behavior, feet structure, and habitat preference. Alligators had U-shaped snouts and were less aggressive, while crocodiles possessed V-shaped snouts and were more territorial.
title: Crocodiles vs. alligators: Spotting the differences

text: Carbon monoxide, a colorless and odorless gas, previously posed severe health risks when it accumulated in the bloodstream, causing tissues to be deprived of oxygen, leading to serious damage or death. Common sources included vehicles, gas appliances, and wood stoves. Symptoms such as headache and dizziness resembled flu without fever, making immediate medical attention crucial for suspected poisoning.
title: Why carbon monoxide is deadly; key facts to know

text: The article dissected the distinctions between toads and frogs, highlighting their taxonomic differences, physical traits, and natural habitats. Toads were noted for their warty skin and terrestrial lifestyle, whereas frogs had moist skin and preferred aquatic environments. It also detailed their reproductive behaviors and vocalizations, emphasizing the need for conservation efforts to maintain ecological balance.
title: Toads vs Frogs: Know the key differences on the basis of skin, population, habitat and more

text: The article distinguished between lambs and sheep, emphasising their developmental stages and characteristics. Lambs, less than a year old, are playful and need more care, while adult sheep are larger and less energetic. title: Understanding the differences between lamb and sheep: Key characteristics and uses

text: India experienced multiple close calls at the Paris Olympics, finishing just outside the medal positions in several events. Losses in archery, shooting, and badminton, among others, hindered India's ambition of achieving a double-digit medal tally. Notable near-misses included the archery mixed team bronze playoff, Arjun Babuta in men's 10m air rifle, and Lakshya Sen in badminton.
title: How India lost as many as five medals by a whisker in Paris

text: In July 2024, tech industry layoffs continued, affecting over 8,000 professionals across 34 companies. Major firms like Intel, Microsoft, and UKG announced significant job cuts, citing financial challenges and strategic shifts. Intel's $10 billion cost-saving initiative led to the largest layoffs, impacting over 15,000 employees, while other firms also streamlined their workforce to adapt to market conditions.
title: Tech layoffs in July 2024: Intel, Microsoft, Dyson & these companies cut thousands jobs

text: The Bombay High Court dismissed a PIL aimed at quashing the Mukhya Mantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana and Mukhya Mantri Yuva Karya Prashikshan Yojana. The petitioner argued that taxpayer money should prioritize infrastructure, but the court upheld the welfare schemes. The judges emphasized the schemes' alignment with Directive Principles of State Policy and justified targeting disadvantaged groups.
tags: Mukhya Mantri Yuva Karya Prashikshan Yojana
Mukhya Mantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana
title: Taxpayers have no say in how money is to be spent, says Bombay HC

text: The Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) is investigating Infosys for allegedly evading more than Rs 32,400 crore in GST payments between July 2017 and March 2022.

text: The Amazon Great Freedom Festival sale saw a surge in OTP scams. Amazon warned customers about fraudsters posing as representatives to steal personal details. The company advised against sharing OTPs over the phone. Shoppers can report suspicious communication to Amazon and register cybercrime complaints via the National Cyber Crime Reporting Portal or call 1930.
title: Amazon Freedom sale: ‘OTP scam warning' from the company

text: The Enforcement Directorate filed a supplementary chargesheet against former railway minister Lalu Prasad, his son Tejashwi Yadav, and others, alleging a land-for-job scam when Prasad was railway minister. The chargesheet names 11 accused and includes 96 documents. The prosecution seeks to prosecute for money laundering and confiscate previously attached assets, with the next hearing slated for August 13.
title: ED files supplementary chargesheet against Lalu, Tejashwi Yadav

text: A US judge ruled against Google in an antitrust case on the same day Donald Trump urged his supporters to stop using Google. Trump, alleging Google’s bias, claimed the search engine was illegitimate.
title: Donald Trump says, "Something’s wrong with Google"

text: Three uniformed personnel, Jithil Jayan of NDRF, his brother Army JCO Jinosh Jayan, and cousin Havildar Praveen Prakash, faced personal loss while assisting in landslide recovery efforts in Wayanad's Chooralmala. The disaster claimed their cousin Jagadeesh, his wife Saritha, and their son Sharan. Only Saritha's body remains missing. The team continues their search for survivors.
title: Army bros conduct rescue ops in their own village

text: In 2024, the tech sector faces unprecedented volatility, with over 8,000 job losses in July alone, bringing the year’s total to 124,517 layoffs globally. Economic pressures and rapid technological shifts drive major companies like Intel and Microsoft to cut staff. To navigate this turbulent landscape, professionals must upskill, showcase their value, and network strategically to enhance job security and prepare for future opportunities.
title: How to secure your position amidst massive tech layoffs in 2024

text: The CBI arrested a man in Tamil Nadu who had been declared dead and missing for two decades after absconding with Rs 50 lakh from a bank in Hyderabad. Disguised as a sadhu, the accused used multiple identities to evade capture. His arrest comes after a protracted investigation highlighting the extensive efforts taken by authorities.
title: Fraudster presumed dead 20 years ago found living as sadhu

text: Sajeeb Wazed Joy, son of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, urged Bangladesh's security forces to uphold the constitution and prevent any unelected government from taking power. He condemned violent protests as terrorism. Hasina resigned and left Bangladesh, with rising protests initially led by students but growing broader, leading to deadly clashes in Dhaka.
title: 'Risk ending up like Pak': Hasina's son after political turmoil in Bangladesh

text: Vinod Kambli, a former dashing left-hander, made a significant impact in the 1990s with his explosive batting. He gained fame for his impressive performances in domestic cricket and international matches. He was known for his flamboyant style and played a crucial role in India's historic Test series win against England in 1993, scoring two centuries in a single match at Old Trafford.
title: 'Unwell' Vinod Kambli struggling to walk properly

text: With just over two months left for assembly elections, NCP president Ajit Pawar began a Jansamman Yatra on August 8 from Dindori, Nashik district. The 24-day tour aims to cover 39 assembly constituencies in Maharashtra. During the yatra, Pawar will engage with various societal groups and highlight Mahayuti government's welfare schemes.
title: Ajit Pawar to go on 24-day ‘Jansamman’ yatra ahead of Maharashtra polls

text: A 12-year-old gangrape survivor from Ayodhya has been admitted to Queen Mary's hospital in Lucknow due to inadequate medical facilities in Ayodhya. She is under observation by expert doctors. The Samajwadi Party has demanded the accused be hanged and compensation for the survivor, highlighting their concerns about potential government retaliation.

text: The production-spec Tata Curvv looks very similar to the concept version. It features a bold front end with an LED lightbar spanning across the width similar to what we’ve seen in the Nexon. It also gets a strong shoulder line with flared wheel arches which gives it a strong presence.

text: Former Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina was safely escorted to India following her resignation amid political turmoil. Security measures were stringent, involving the Indian Air Force and top officials. National Security Advisor Ajit Doval met her upon arrival, and an interim government was announced in Bangladesh. Hasina exited following political crisis prompted by violent protests and vandalism.

text: 26-year-old Neeraj Chopra has won numerous titles, including Asian Games and Commonwealth Games gold, and is the defending Olympic and world champion. text: A place in the final, confirmation of a medal -- the stakes are pretty high, even higher for India, who haven't played an Olympic hockey final for 44 years and have not won successive hockey medals at the Games for 52 years. And PR Sreejesh will hope that he finishes his career with a medal in the biggest game of his iconic career, an Olympic final. For each of the above to happen, India will have to beat Germany.

text: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, surged in opening trade on Tuesday after a huge fall the previous day. While BSE Sensex moved above 79,600 levels, Nifty50 was above 24,300.

text: For nearly two decades, Basheer Kalathiparambil, 44, has been a constant presence in Kerala's major tragedies. An electrician by profession, Basheer has handled hundreds of bodies in disasters like cyclone Ockhi, the Kavalappara landslide, and the recent Wayanad landslide. His volunteer work involves marking and cleaning bodies, selflessly aiding authorities and grieving families.

text: Coordinators of the recent student protests in Bangladesh proposed forming a new interim government with Nobel Peace laureate Muhammad Yunus as chief advisor.
